critique: The document reflects President Roosevelt's approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Marking Devices Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was a key component of the New Deal, aimed at regulating industries to promote recovery during the Great Depression. The code establishes an industry authority with government oversight, indicating a move towards government intervention in the economy. There is no information about immigration, executive power, federalism, security/liberty, or social inclusion.
